responses.rationale: The segment reports an event (death) rather than prices or economic metrics.
The segment reports research findings/beliefs rather than prices or economic metrics.
The segment reports evidence of spread rather than prices or economic metrics.
The segment reports study findings rather than prices or economic metrics.
The segment reports a conclusion/quote rather than prices or economic metrics.
The segment reports disease spread and deaths, not prices or economic metrics.
The segment reports increased risk/chance rather than prices or economic metrics.
The segment reports a death rate percentage, which is not an economic metric as defined by Q9 examples.
Reports production volume projections ('produce up to 14.9 million tons', 'up to 15.35 million tons') using standard verbs.
Reports production volume and percentage increase ('produce up to 14.9 million tons', 'up to 15.35 million tons', 'increase of up to 2.6%', 'up to 3.7%') using standard verbs.
Reports market share percentage and change ('hold a nearly 38% market share', 'up from around 36%') using standard verbs.
The segment reports quotes and opinions rather than prices or economic metrics.
Reports export volume and value estimates ('end at a record of up to 5.15 million tons', 'between $9.5 billion and $10 billion') using standard verbs.
Reports export volume projection ('will reach up to 5.3 million tons') using a standard verb.
